intro: Zornia dyctiocarpa var. filifolia, commonly known as the filifoliate zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are finely divided. The plant produces small, clustered pink to red flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive and drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
